1.text: These things have I spoken to you, that you should not be offended.

2.text: They shall put you out of the synagogues: yes, the time comes, that whoever kills you will think that he does God service.

3.text: And these things will they do to you, because they have not known the Father, nor me.

4.text: But these things have I told you, that when the time shall come, you may remember that I told you of them. And these things I said not to you at the beginning, because I was with you.

5.text: But now I go my way to him that sent me; and none of you asks me, Where go you?

6.text: But because I have said these things to you, sorrow has filled your heart.

7.text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth; It is expedient for you that I go away: for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come to you; but if I depart, I will send him to you.

8.text: And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

9.text: Of sin, because they believe not on me;

10.text: Of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and you see me no more;

11.text: Of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.

12.text: I have yet many things to say to you, but you cannot bear them now.

13.text: However, when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he will guide you into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatever he shall hear, that shall he speak: and he will show you things to come.

14.text: He shall glorify me: for he shall receive of mine, and shall show it to you.

15.text: All things that the Father has are mine: therefore said I, that he shall take of mine, and shall show it to you.

16.text: A little while, and you shall not see me: and again, a little while, and you shall see me, because I go to the Father.

17.text: Then said some of his disciples among themselves, What is this that he said to us, A little while, and you shall not see me: and again, a little while, and you shall see me: and, Because I go to the Father?

18.text: They said therefore, What is this that he said, A little while? we cannot tell what he said.

19.text: Now Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him, and said to them, Do you inquire among yourselves of that I said, A little while, and you shall not see me: and again, a little while, and you shall see me?

20.text: Truly, truly, I say to you, That you shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice: and you shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall be turned into joy.

21.text: A woman when she is in travail has sorrow, because her hour is come: but as soon as she is delivered of the child, she remembers no more the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.

22.text: And you now therefore have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man takes from you.

23.text: And in that day you shall ask me nothing. Truly, truly, I say to you, Whatever you shall ask the Father in my name, he will give it you.

24.text: Till now have you asked nothing in my name: ask, and you shall receive, that your joy may be full.

25.text: These things have I spoken to you in proverbs: but the time comes, when I shall no more speak to you in proverbs, but I shall show you plainly of the Father.

26.text: At that day you shall ask in my name: and I say not to you, that I will pray the Father for you:

27.text: For the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me, and have believed that I came out from God.

28.text: I came forth from the Father, and am come into the world: again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.

29.text: His disciples said to him, See, now speak you plainly, and speak no proverb.

30.text: Now are we sure that you know all things, and need not that any man should ask you: by this we believe that you came forth from God.

31.text: Jesus answered them, Do you now believe?

32.text: Behold, the hour comes, yes, is now come, that you shall be scattered, every man to his own, and shall leave me alone: and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

33.text: These things I have spoken to you, that in me you might have peace. In the world you shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.
